com.clrs.sorting

Class HeapSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.clrs.sorting.HeapSort

  • public class HeapSort
extends Object
    Sorts arrays via HeapSort for more details about Heapsort see Heap Sort Wiki
    See Also:
    MergeSort, QuickSort, InsertionSort, BubbleSort

      • sort

        public static void sort(int[] array)
        Sorts an int[] in ascending order using heap sort.
        Parameters:
        array - takes a integer array as input

      • build_min_heap

        private static void build_min_heap(int[] array,
                  int heapsize)
        Builds a min-heap of the given array and heapsize.
        Parameters:
        array - whose min heap is to be formed
        heapsize - the total size of the heap. Note that heapsize ≤ length of the array.
        See Also:
        min_heapify(int[],int,int)

      • min_heapify

        private static void min_heapify(int[] array,
               int index,
               int heapsize)
        Builds a heap of the array from the given index and heapsize.

        This method tries to place the smallest element from the sub-tree rooted at index at index.

        Parameters:
        array - the array whose heap must be computed.
        index - the root of the subtree where the smallest index element be kept.
        heapsize - the heapsize of the subtree.

      • parent

        private static int parent(int index)
        Gets the parent of the given child node.
        Returns:
        the parent index of the given child.

      • left_child

        private static int left_child(int index)
        Gets the left child of the given parent node.
        Returns:

      • right_child

        private static int right_child(int index)
        Gets the right child of the given parent node.
        Returns:
        the right index of the given parent node.
